channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Dominion, the voting tech company at the center of false 2020 claims, is sold
item.description: Dominion Voting Systems, the company at the center of false fraud claims about the 2020 election, has been acquired by an entity called Liberty Vote.
item.content:encoded:
Dominion Voting Systems, the company at the center of false fraud claims about the 2020 election, has been acquired by an entity called Liberty Vote.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Justice Department indicts Letitia James after pressure from Trump
item.description: The indictment comes after steady pressure from President Trump to prosecute James, who successfully sued Trump and his company for inflating the value of some of its properties.
item.content:encoded:
The indictment comes after steady pressure from President Trump to prosecute James, who successfully sued Trump and his company for inflating the value of some of its properties.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Once the Gaza ceasefire goes into effect, what happens next? Here's what to know
item.description: Israel and Hamas have reached an agreement for the "first phase" of a plan promoted by President Trump to end the war in Gaza. A ceasefire is expected to go into effect after an Israeli Cabinet vote.
item.content:encoded:
Israel and Hamas have reached an agreement for the "first phase" of a plan promoted by President Trump to end the war in Gaza. A ceasefire is expected to go into effect after an Israeli Cabinet vote.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: How the Trump administration is reshaping the military
item.description: President Trump is deploying National Guard troops to U.S. cities, erasing "woke" in the military and striking alleged drug boats off Venezuela. The Atlantic's Nancy Youssef discusses what this means.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is deploying National Guard troops to U.S. cities, erasing "woke" in the military and striking alleged drug boats off Venezuela. The Atlantic's Nancy Youssef discusses what this means.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: What to know about the Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: Anticipation is growing and bookies around the world are taking bets on who'll be awarded this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here is what to know ahead of the award announcement this week.
item.content:encoded:
Anticipation is growing and bookies around the world are taking bets on who'll be awarded this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here is what to know ahead of the award announcement this week.

(Image credit: Jonathan Nackstrand)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: The 10th and final escapee from a New Orleans jailbreak is captured after five months
item.description: Ten men escaped the Orleans Parish Justice Center through a hole in the wall behind a toilet on May 16. Most were captured within days, but Derrick Groves managed to elude authorities until Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: Ten men escaped the Orleans Parish Justice Center through a hole in the wall behind a toilet on May 16. Most were captured within days, but Derrick Groves managed to elude authorities until Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Why being in credit card debt doesn't mean you're bad with money
item.description: Financial educators bust three common myths about credit card debt — and explain why these negative assumptions can hold us back from making smart money decisions.
item.content:encoded: Financial educators bust three common myths about credit card debt — and explain why these negative assumptions can hold us back from making smart money decisions.
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: China curbs rare earth exports, raising stakes before Trump-Xi talks
item.description: Analysts say Thursday's announcement is China's bid to strengthen its leverage in trade talks with the U.S., ahead of a planned leaders' meeting.
item.content:encoded:
Analysts say Thursday's announcement is China's bid to strengthen its leverage in trade talks with the U.S., ahead of a planned leaders' meeting.

(Image credit: Pedro Pardo)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Israel and Hamas reach initial ceasefire deal. And, National Guard arrive near Chicago
item.description: Israel and Hamas have agreed to the "first phase" of a ceasefire deal. And, hundreds of National Guard troops were deployed to the greater Chicago area at President Trump's request.
item.content:encoded:
Israel and Hamas have agreed to the "first phase" of a ceasefire deal. And, hundreds of National Guard troops were deployed to the greater Chicago area at President Trump's request.

(Image credit: Abood Abusalama/Middle East Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Bipartisan negotiations are the 'obvious way out' of the shutdown, says Sen. Dick Durbin
item.description: As the government shutdown reaches its ninth day, Democratic Sen. Dick Durbin is calling on Republicans to resume negotiations in Washington as Congress remains divided over health care and funding.
item.content:encoded:
As the government shutdown reaches its ninth day, Democratic Sen. Dick Durbin is calling on Republicans to resume negotiations in Washington as Congress remains divided over health care and funding.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
